text: <!channel> does anyone know if the trailer was designed with a heating source?  The high temperature in Ann Arbor for Tuesday is going to be 25 degrees.
Maybe space heater should have been an item to add to students' shopping lists?
We currently have done no testing on the hardware, Mac mini, touch screen, and camera in freezing environment.  Will need to test if the touch panel works with gloves on.
<@U02918BKW|john> has joined the channel
we had at least mentioned it as part of the design process
that it should be a consideration
i doubt anything prevents the trailer from plugging in a small space heater
in fact, I'm guessing it's pretty easy
but i don't know that anywhere along the line they actually PLANNED for space heaters
yeah - they trimmed so much when we went into production
I know some of the early concepts called for that to built in
but that all got cut
I'd say it's 50/50 whether the current build will be able to handle a space heater without getting a little creative
I believe we have standard outlets wired into the main rooms, but I don't know if our power source is designed to handle the extra load

<@U02918BKW> - not that this particular issue should be uncorked's concern, but it would breally great if you could touch base with Advantage - thank them for the help this morning and then ask them about heat options.
wait you want these students to be COMFORTABLE too?
this gives them great opportunities to ask for things like hot chocolate and coffee
also - i want to go on record as being pretty jealous that you're heading out. ALL of my relatives are in Ann Arbor
I want to go on record as being very happy to *not* go to ann arbor in February
I'm jealous too. I want to see my family in Michigan.

<@U0265G76F>: I'm not looking for student comfort - I just dont want to have to worry that the camera's autofocus lens will lock up in the cold or something stupid like that.   the mini and the monitor both generate a good amount of heat on their own such that I'm not too concerned about them.
i hear you
Somebody recently strapped a iPhone 6 to a weather balloon and it made it pretty high before it froze and stopped functioning.
didn't do the typical Uncorked freezing QA process on this one
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hz1ipDYpAgQ>

attachments.title: Weather balloon GPS space flight iPhone camera footage homemade spacecraft 100,000 ft altitude HD

text: ^--- they used hand warmers to keep the iPhone warm...   cheaters
that video is actually pretty damn awesome
